intro: Erysimum pusillum subsp. pusillum, commonly known as dwarf wallflower, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, including walls and slopes. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
